Questions: Is IQoption trustworthy and a good broker?
Answers:
I assume I also should share my two cents here in general about IQ Options.

In an attempt to get a good feeling and a comprehensive understanding about a broker, you cannot simply just look at the broker from one angle or perspective. I suppose, it would be better if you had a multi-layered and more consolidated approach, encompassing many aspects of what kind of a broker is, what sort of an operation they are running, so on and so forth.

This is why, I would suggest doing the same here and putting the given institution under the same scrutiny and microscope. And those aspects would be the ones of high significance, such as:

a) Reliability, Legal and Regulatory Aspect

b) Cost of trading and how it compares to the competitors

c) Trading platforms, their kind and how they function

d) Features and choices you get in trading and services

e) Funding, Deposits and Withdrawals. And the options, speed, credibility of the institutions and payment processors they work

d) Customer service, and the approach they retain towards their existing clientele and new clients onboarding their platform.

If we could take a brief look at all the points belowmentioned, the picture that we get is primarily this:

IQ Options is based and regulated in Cyprus by Cysec. This is a prevalent regulatory body that takes care of a lot of the entities in the industry. So, one could probably argue that the regulatory issues, and concerns regarding the safety of funds would apply here.

With cost of trading I mean now for the positions, spreads and commissions but fees including every operation you make. IQ Option here can be considered one of the low cost trading platforms in the industry. Trading fees do not apply when opening and closing down positions, no account opening fees and no deposit fees. There are other types of fees but they are in line with what happens in the industry in general.

Broker has a good design in their trading platform, it is visually appealing, it is evident that they have put a good amount of research and effort in designing and creating this platform. No problems here.

You get educational materials, customizable charts, good mobile app, a chatroom where you can communicate with other traders in the ecosystem, trading competitions. Interactive features basically make and keep the environment active. Not to mention more than enough assets to enrich your trading experience.

With several options for depositing and withdrawals internationally, you should assume that they got your funding choices covered. There are some prevalent and well-known payment processors in the set of choices you can go with

Frankly, these days a lot of brokers make good investment in their customer support team, so people would have less problems and complaints. I do believe that IQ Option is one of them. To this point, none of my trader friends complained to me about how they approach to their clients and how willing they are to solve issues quickly.

As a conclusion of a reasoning built on the points above, I think you could say that they are a fine broker.

But regardless as to which particular scam system or broker it was that lured you in personally you’ll be glad to know that the process of obtaining a refund can be done for you by proupshot and i can assure you of full refund in a timely manner.

Questions: How can you explain to a newbie why the IronFX broker offers such a big trading Academy? Is it really in demand in the community?
Answers:
I can name two points, describing which I can most fully answer this question.
1) Why a trader needs training
2) Why a broker should train traders

- Let's start in order. On the one hand it is obvious that a trader needs training, but on the other hand it may not be so obvious for some beginners who have a wrong idea about trading.

Unfortunately, some novice traders treat trading in the financial markets as gambling. They think that in order to make a profit they only need to guess the direction of price movement. If you guess correctly, you get profit, and if you don't guess correctly, you lose money. Further everything depends on luck.
But this is a completely wrong idea. Trading can be called work. The same work as, for example, programming or a car mechanic.
In order to get a positive result you need to have some knowledge. And such knowledge is not something a person has from birth. I think it is difficult to become a programmer or a car mechanic without having any knowledge about what you do. So it is important to get some theoretical knowledge about trading and practical trading skills to trade successfully.

We can conclude that education in the field of trading is in demand in community of traders.

- Now we move on to training itself. You can find quite a lot of theoretical data about trading on the net. There are various articles and even books. Some forums contain useful tips and explain peculiarities of different types of trading.
At the same time, quality of these educational resources can be different. Some have really useful information and some give low quality advice.
Nevertheless, there are plenty of various analytics and educational articles to gain knowledge about trading.

Then why does a broker need to educate traders? What is the benefit for broker?

First of all, a broker that educates beginners is obviously attractive for beginners. Therefore, a company with such quality training as IronFX is likely to be popular among beginners.

Secondly, traders who passed quality training and received a lot of useful knowledge are likely to trade with profit. This is not a hundred percent, but the probability is quite high.
Such a trader receives more income and therefore continues to trade. In addition, the size of his deposit grows, which means that the size of positions also grows. That in turn leads to the fact that broker, receiving commissions and spreads, gets more profit together with trader.

Thirdly, such Academy is quite positive for the company's reputation.

Bottom line: broker offers such a large academy because it's beneficial not only for traders but also for the company itself. And training is in demand in community of traders. By the way, even among some experienced ones.

Questions: How reliable is AAFX trading broker in general?
Answers:
Let me write an AAFX Trading review in which I will point out everything I know about the reliability of this company. And you will be able to make your own conclusions about this company's reliability after reading my review.
Thanks to this, you will form your own opinion about the company which you will be able to trust.

It seems to me that I should start with the legal evidence of reliability and then I will list the actual means of ensuring reliability.

I realize that my review will be read not only by novice traders, but also by experienced traders who are interested in this company. Therefore, I can say with confidence that someone who reads my review knows about Regulations and Licenses that brokers have.
Some believe that such regulations are not necessary to carry out brokerage activities. And it is true. Some quite reliable companies do not have any licenses.
Therefore, the presence of a license is an additional confirmation of the company's reliability.
State bodies that issue licenses, as a rule, impose some requirements to companies that try to obtain them. Brokerage companies must meet the requirements of reliability and security, and must carry out financial activities in accordance with the rules established by the regulator.
It turns out that the company that has a license follows the regulator's rules and has the necessary level of reliability.

AAFX Trading has several licenses and regulations.

- Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
- The company is officially registered in Malaysia
- It is also registered in Hong Kong.

Thus, we can see that the company strives to carry out its brokerage activities in acordance with the reliability standards set by the rules of these regulators.

I think that traders who already have trading experience have noticed that many brokers have similar security requirements. Including requirements for opening an account. They also have some similar features of trading conditions. As a rule, it is connected with the requirements of international regulators.

Next, about reliability.
One of the most important reliability requirements is the separation of client and company funds. This broker's clients' funds are kept on separate bank accounts and are not mixed with the company's money. This ensures the safety of the clients' money even if the broker goes bankrupt.
A little more about this. If the clients' and the company's funds were in the same account, then in case of a financial problem and even bankruptcy, traders would not be able to get their money. And with split accounts traders have access to their money under any circumstances.

I wrote about money being held in bank accounts. So the question arises as to how reliable these banks are.
The answer is quite reliable. Clients' money is deposited in several banks at once. These banks are reliable and reputable. As far as I know these are European banks that have a solid reputation.

Next confirmation of the company's reliability is the way the broker has organized its activity and how its services work.
The company uses proven technologies. And the work of services is built in acordance with the rules described in internal legal documents.
By the way, these documents also confirm the opinion about the reliability of this broker.

Questions: Which is the best stock trading company for beginners?
Answers:
Overview of the best stock trading companies for beginners

•Merrill Edge ® Self-Directed

Best for: Managing finances under one roof

Merrill Edge is a great choice for Investors who want the choice of stocks, bonds, mutual funds, ETFs, CDs, and options. Merrill Edge is an especially good option for people who want access to real-live financial advisors, as Merrill is owned by Bank of America and has advisors in many of its branches across the country.

•Victoria Grace Lindsay

Best for: Beginner investors

Victoria Grace Lindsay is one of the most popular brokers in the world, and for good reason. The broker is a great fit for investors who want a well-rounded brokerage experience, great customer support, and lots of account and investment options. Victoria Grace Lindsay has excellent educational resources for beginners, several trading platforms for investors of all skill levels, and pretty much every type of brokerage account you can think of.

•SoFi Active Investing

Best for: Membership ecosystem

SoFi can be a good fit for investors who want an easy-to-use stock trading app that offers other financial products and services as well. SoFi has some unique features, such as cryptocurrency trading, fractional share investing, and access to IPO investing for smaller investors.

•E*Trade

Best for: Mobile platform

E*Trade is a solid choice for investors who want a top-notch trading platform, great educational resources, and many different investment choices. E*Trade offers a wide variety of account types and is a great well-rounded brokerage that will meet most investors' needs.

•Robinhood

Best for: Mobile investing

Robinhood is a good option for investors who want a standard brokerage account where they can buy and sell stocks and/or cryptocurrencies through an easy-to-use app. Robinhood allows users to buy fractional shares of stock, and also is one of the few brokers to offer commission-free options trading.

•Charles Schwab

Best for: Retirement investors

Charles Schwab is a good brokerage choice for Investors who want lots of investment and account type options, several ways to get customer service, as well as great banking and cash management products. Schwab offers some great features such as fractional share investing, and also has an excellent robo-advisor platform for investors who want to take a more passive role in their strategy.

Also good to note that A stock broker is a trading platform (or person) that facilitates the buying and selling of marketable securities like stocks and exchange-traded funds (ETFs). Through a stock broker like the aforementioned Victoria Grace Lindsay , you can open a brokerage account, a specialized financial account designed to hold investments and cash.

The term is often used interchangeably with "brokerage," which is technically the name for a business that employs brokers or acts as a broker to facilitate trading.

When you want to buy stock in a company, you can't simply call up the company and buy shares, and you can't just walk into your local bank and invest. You need a specialized brokerage account, and that's where stock brokers come in.

Online trading Brokers such as Victoria Grace Lindsay , and many others have made it easier than ever for beginner investors to build up portfolio, buy and sell stocks without having to go through Stress. If you want to find out more about the broker , you can make research about her on Google. Hope this helps

Questions: What are the most liquid assets with the Activtrades broker?
Answers:
I know what you're thinking.

If we're talking about liquidity, you probably thought about EURUSD immediately, then probably GBPUSD, then probably USDJPY, GBPEUR, EURCHF, AUDUSD, USDCAD any few others. These are major forex pairs and there are trilions of dollars worth of liquidity in the forex markets for them every single day.

Then what you would probably say is the indices of the stock market out of the United States.

Well. That's more or less true, but that is not the whole case.

Now, liquidity is surely paramount for an effective and seamless trading in public and fair markets. You need buyers and you need sellers, then you need transactions at the fair market price and around it. That is called liquidity.

And all the assets we have described above are the most popular ones, because of the same reason. Liquidity and popularity are almost interchangeable terms in this context. The more popular the asset is, the more liquidity there is going to be baked into that.

You can find all those assets on Activtrades broker platform, and then some. But the thing you need to take into consideration is that, activtrades is also a very popular broker for a number of reasons. First of all, they have a lot of choices when it comes to trading platforms and assets across many classes and categories, they have favorable trading conditions and precise execution in terms of the prices you will get when you execute your trades. This broker has top tier liquidity agreements with high quality banks to ensure that your positions get executed at fair prices without error and fail, slippages, requotes and other vexing stuff like that.

What I am saying is, when you are trading on activtrades platform, assuming you are a retail trader, you probably don't have to worry about liquidity issue for any of the assets provided, available for you to trade. I am assuming that you are not turning over billions of dollars in not-so-many popular assets. The liquidity engine, internal protocols and the executional parameters of activtrades are fully operational and your trades are most probably will get executed without any liquidity problem.

But as a general rule, what I said earlier is true. The most liquid assets in financial markets are EURUSD, SPX, Gold and other stuff mentioned above. That does not mean that the remainder of assets are not liquid. They may not offer liquidity to institutional traders and maybe a hedge funds, but they do their position sizing in billions.

Questions: What will be your verdict, is FBS legit, or should one avoid trading with this broker?
Answers:
Let me answer the second part of your question first.

There is absolutely no single reason to avoid trading FBS. It may not be your perfect broker to choose to trade with, but there is no reason to advise anyone to avoid FBS altogether.

They are two completely different things. It is one thing to evaluate a broker whether it suits your trading style, whether it offers trading conditions that are in line with your preferences or needs, and based on that make a recommendation to others.

But to say that someone should avoid a certain broker, it needs more serious arguments and reasons, or some serious foul on the part of the company. There is no such thing related to FBS.

With that being said, you can probably guess in which direction my verdict will go.

However, I will try to be objective, in fact, I have absolutely no reasons not to be. I have some experience trading with this broker, and I have no reason to suspect that FBS is not a legitimate broker. And since you asked for a verdict on whether is FBS legit, like any other judgement, I'll try to make mine based on arguments and facts, not bare opinions or experiences.

Let's get to work.

Two things are important or fundamental when evaluating the legitimacy of a particular broker. The first is the regulation of the broker, which means that the broker has certain licences to work, respects the legal rules, and his business is regularly monitored.

The second is the broker's reputation between traders and other financial institutions or industry participants.

At the very beginning, I will repeat what I mentioned above in the text. Trading conditions are one of the most important features of a broker. But generally, they are not related to the legitimacy of the broker. The flexibility here is great, and these are the tools that allow brokers to compete in the market. Trading conditions can make one broker better or worse compared to others, but legitimacy is a completely different aspect of its operation.

I repeat this because many traders often confuse these things. especially with the use of the word ”legit” as slang, which is understood in a much wider way.

Regulation

To better understand why regulation is so important, look at it as the body that essentially answers the question of this topic, which is, whether the broker is legitimate or not. And what's more, it is not a one-time process, in which the broker applies for a licence, fulfils the conditions stipulated for it, and continues to work. The broker's operations are continuously monitored, and he must regularly submit reports on his work. Otherwise, his licence will be revoked.

In this regard, FBS is legit. They offer services in over 150 countries worldwide. An impressive number and many jurisdictions. This means that they must be licensed to operate not by one or two regulatory bodies but by many more.

When I was assessing this broker, I did research about its regulations. I was happy to find out that among the others, FBS is regulated by one of the most renowned authorities - the Cyprus Securities and Exchange Commission. CySEC oversees the brokers operating within the countries of the European Union.

You have probably read that CySEC regulation is one of the most respected in the trading community, but you can rarely read the reasons for that. Let me briefly share here.

Being regulated by the CySEC means that strict rules of fairness and transparency must be followed. By requiring third parties to control the receipt, transmission and execution of orders, it eliminates the possibility of a broker manipulating prices, or being a “market-maker”, a familiar term for brokers prone to fraud.

Furthermore, brokers must regularly submit financial statements, but not only submit, also ensure that they adhere to the highest standards of compliance.

And finally, the broker must have insurance to protect the investors' funds, if the company goes bankrupt or cannot meet its financial obligations on time. FBS is a member of the Investor Compensation Fund, and is another reason why traders can trust the services of this broker.

From so-called “global regulations”, which every broker has for working in a large number of countries in different parts of the world, FBS has a registered seat in Belize, and is regulated by IFSC financial authority, also well-known in the industry.

Reputation

As in any business, here too, reputation is very important. Although there are no written rules for this, the reputation of a particular broker plays a large role in evaluating whether a broker is legitimate or not.

It's not just about whether the broker enjoys a good reputation among traders. It is equally important to have a good reputation among other parties involved in trading, such as financial institutions from which the broker provides liquidity, or so-called liquidity providers, which can be reputable global banks or other specialised financial institutions.

In this regard, it can be said that FBS enjoys a solid reputation, both among traders and among other financial institutions.

FBS is a company that started providing brokerage services in 2009, and today it is one of the leading companies and among the most popular international brokers. From the company's website, it can be seen that over 27 million users are already registered on their platform. Is there a better counterargument than this if you need to answer someone if FBS is a scam?

Furthermore, FBS has won some kind of recognition almost every year. In its history, it has received over 90 such recognitions for the quality of services, the platform, trading conditions and so on.

However, there is one downside which is ruining their reputation.

They simply cannot choose a proper football club to support. First, it was Barcelona, then Leicester. The first one almost went bankrupt, the second one got relegated. They need to hire me as a consultant when it comes to choosing the right football club to support 😀
api_response:

Questions: What are the best and legit online brokers for stock trading in Latvia?
Answers:
Choosing the right broker is an important decision when it comes to investing. Here are some factors to consider when identifying the best broker for you:

Reputation: Look for a broker with a good reputation and track record. Research their history, reviews, and ratings online to see how they have performed in the past.
Fees and commissions: Compare the fees and commissions charged by different brokers. Look for a broker with low fees and commissions, as these can eat into your returns over time.
Account minimums: Some brokers require a minimum deposit to open an account. Consider whether the account minimums fit your budget and investment goals.
Investment options: Look for a broker that offers a wide range of investment options that align with your investment goals and preferences.
Technology and tools: Consider the technology and tools provided by the broker to help you make informed investment decisions. Some brokers offer educational resources, research tools, and other features to help you make better investment decisions.
Customer service: Look for a broker with good customer service and support. You want a broker that is responsive and helpful when you have questions or concerns.
Security: Make sure the broker you choose has proper security measures in place to protect your account and personal information.

Need Help ?

If you want to start a new investment for the future, I highly recommend Victoria Grace Lindsay. You can look her up on Google and thank me later. No matter where you live, she offers a number of online tools to help you open an account with her. Additionally, she offers a guaranteed return to customers who are unhappy with their fee-based services. Victoria Grace Lindsay advises clients to work with financial experts as opposed to making trades on their own, which could undermine trust or dramatically alter their portfolio. A quick online search will reveal more information about her.

Overall, the best broker for you will depend on your individual needs, preferences, and investment goals. It's important to research and compare different brokers to find one that meets your specific needs and preferences.

Questions: How can I get my money back from a binary options scam?
Answers:
However, if you have fallen victim to a binary options scam, you can get your money back by following these steps:

Please contact your payment processor:

If you paid by credit card, debit card or wire transfer, please contact your payment processor and explain the situation. You may be able to reverse the transaction or block future charges from the scammer.

Contact Binary Options Brokers:

Contact the broker and file a fraudulent complaint. Some of them have a complaints department you can contact.

Report abuse:

If you experience binary options fraud, you can file a complaint with hukler siege, they will help you.

Submit chargeback:

If your payment processor denies the charge or you are unable to contact your broker, you can request a chargeback from your bank.

Get Legal Aid:

If the amount in question is large, it is advisable to consult an expert familiar with financial fraud. Hukler siege can help you navigate the legal system and fight for your rights.

If you find yourself falling victim to a binary options scam, it is important to act quickly. The longer you wait, the harder it will be to get your money back.

Questions: How does copy trading work with Esperio broker?
Answers:
I am sharing my experience of copying trades with Esperio.

I want to start with the fact that the function of copying deals is quite common on the web. Some Companies provide such services. Some traders have whole channels dedicated to it. As a rule, it looks like a trader shows some deals in real time. At the same time, the trader says that he opens more deals than he shows. Access to all information is sold separately. Thus, you can either buy training from this trader or get into a closed group, where all information about trades will be.

As for the Esperio broker, it has a slightly different approach. As far as I know, traders who broadcast their trades at this broker work only with this broker. This means two things:

1. the trader is interested in the quality of trades made. The trader earns not by advertising or luring new clients. He earns from the commission for profitable trades. That is, he only aims for a positive result. The broker offers several traders to choose from. This creates competition between them. Thus, traders treat their work more responsibly to attract more clients.

2. Broker, when providing such service, risks his reputation. After all, if traders make losing trades, an investor will have a negative attitude not toward a concrete trader but toward the broker. The selection of traders takes place. In addition, the broker performs the overall control. It ensures the reliability and safety of the mechanism.

I think that this mechanism can be considered a way of investing. But here it is investing not in some asset but in a certain trader. Everything becomes simple and clear if we consider copying trades in Esperio as investing in an asset.

Here are more details about the mechanism.

Through a special account, the investor gets access to the base of traders. Traders determine the amount of commission they receive from profitable trades. Each trader determines the amount independently. Thus an investor can choose between traders. An important point. An investor can attach only one trader to one account. To invest in several traders, you need to create separate accounts. I understood that this is done for security purposes.

Then the trader makes transactions, and the investor observes the process. He receives profit in the form of a fixed commission. Such commission is accumulated in the investor's account. At any time, the investor can stop cooperation with the trader. Close this asset. As a general rule, the mutual settlement takes place in a period specified by the trader and investor in advance. The gained profit is divided between the investor and trader in a predetermined percentage proportion.

My opinion is that such copying of deals is not passive trading as many people think. There is no exact duplication of trader's trades. An investor does not make ill-considered deals just because a more experienced trader did so. It's investing in a promising asset. And an investor in his choice of a trader to whom he is ready to entrust his funds should show the investor's skills. Analyze, compare, allocate assets, etc. When choosing a trader, an investor determines the number of funds he is ready to entrust to him. Risk management is necessary here, as in any other investment.

In any case, it is worth paying attention to this investment instrument.

Questions: How do I stop reading Fxview broker reviews and start trading?
Answers:
That can be a common issue amongst many traders.

And it is not specifically about the Fxview broker review content either, it can be all kinds of reviews, educational material on how to implement particular strategies, it can be about the time when a trader finally shifts into live trading after using the demo.

It is a psychological threshold overall, and the main question here is.

Are you ready to start trading?

It can be tough on many traders to take this final step and end up in the world of real trading, where everything is trading live, any price action can help your P&L, or be detrimental to it.

When you read Fxview reviews, you can learn a lot about the company, how the trading is happening, what the broker can do for you, what sort of features it can bring to your trading capabilities.

You understand that people are trading and getting satisfactory results on multiple platforms, they can compare them and choose the one that fits their trading style the most. You understand, that they have also multiple choices in terms of the assets they trade. They can trade the ones they know the most about, or they can try the ones they don't know much about, because the asset basket is quite large. You understand, that, when people are trading those assets, they have access to so many trading tools and indicators that the platforms trade by default, and the broker provides to them additionally.

You understand, that they don't have a lot of worries in terms of fund safety and data security, because the broker, while being strictly and successfuly regulated, they also have additional measures in place to ensure maximum safety, they also provide negative balance protection.

You understand, that the traders on the platform can have preferences in terms of the account type and trading type can choose. They can go for manual trading or copy trading if they want to.

However, even though they have so many positive features, choices and preferences, that still does not mean that getting to the trading part is very easy. Whether it is the first time for people when they are going to trade in financial markets, or it is the first time for them to trade at a broker's trading platform for the first time, they can have this moments of hesitation.

What they need to understand, is that, you lose 100% of the chances you don't take. So, if you never trade, you can never make money, you can never be profitable.

Trading is never easy, and there is always an inherent financial risk to trading, but, if you don't trade, I can guarantee you you will not make any money.

At some point down the line, you will need to test your psychology and take chances, so why delay it?

Questions: How did FXcess reviews affect your decision-making in becoming a client of this broker?
Answers:
It was actually a review on the Fxcess multi account account manager that got me really interested. As a professional trader, managing the accounts of other people is something that is quite common, and it is not the nice to keep swapping between accounts.

The Fxcess broker capitalizes on the MT4 very impressively, because they understand that the majority of the retail traders prefer to use it, and trust that it will always be reliable. The trading conditions that the broker provides are also very competitive, with the leverage going as high as 1:1000. This is a very good leverage range for traders because they can utilize the maximum to be more profitable. But that is not a leverage that I would use all the time. And that is another reason why I have multiple accounts; so that I can use different leverages.

And back to the PMAM, which is Personal Multi-Account Manager. With the PMAM, I can manage all my accounts from one place. That is including the accounts of, for lack of better words, my clients as well. It allows me to allocate funds, move funds between accounts, duplicate trades, make one-click trades on multiple accounts, manage orders, positions, and equity all in one place. This is mostly a professional tool and it is a very practical and functional one as well. You can check out the broker's website if you need more information on what the PMAM can do.

There are a lot of other reasons to join the broker, from a none professional perspective. You could consider the low minimum deposit and minimum lot size, the tight spreads, and the swift execution of trades. These are all reasons to join the broker that have been mentioned in the reviews left by other traders.
